formName: Register a non-resident company for Corporation Tax

sections.title: About you

fields.infoText:
Provide the contact details of someone authorised to discuss this form with HMRC. 

We will contact this person if we have a question about this registration.

fields.label: Telephone number
fields.helpText: For international numbers include the country code

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: We will also use this to send you a confirmation email

fields.label: Select the role relevant to you
fields.helpText: You must be one of the following to register on behalf of the business

sections.title: Are you disposing of any UK properties?

fields.label: Are you disposing of any UK properties?
fields.helpText: A disposal of a property refers to a sale, a gift or a transfer of ownership

sections.title: Do you want to report any other UK business activity to HMRC?

fields.label: Do you want to report any other UK business activity to HMRC?
UK business activities chargeable to UK Corporation Tax
fields.infoText:
Activities chargeable to UK Corporation Tax are:
You must tell HMRC if you are:

• selling assets

• carrying on a business activity such as a trade or professional activity

• buying and selling goods with a view to making a profit

• providing services

• earning interest

• managing investments

• receiving any other income

sections.title: You cannot use this service

fields.label: whyCannotUseService
fields.infoText: You must be selling a UK property or conducting a UK business activity in order to register a non-resident company for UK Corporation Tax.

sections.title: Does the company you are registering have a Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference?

fields.label: Does the company you are registering have a Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference?
fields.helpText: This is on tax returns and other letters about Corporation Tax. It may be called ‘reference’, ‘UTR’ or ‘official use’.

sections.title: What is the Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference?

fields.label: What is the Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference?
fields.helpText: A Unique Taxpayer Reference is 10 numbers like 12345 67890. It will be on tax returns and other letters about Corporation Tax. It may be called 'reference', 'UTR' or 'official use'.

sections.title: What is the company name?

fields.label: What is the company name?
fields.helpText: Enter the name of the company you are registering

sections.title: What is the current company name?

fields.label: If your company name has changed since you last registered it will not be updated in other government services.
fields.infoText: If your company name has changed since you last registered it will not be updated in other government services.

sections.title: Does the company have an employer PAYE reference number?

fields.label: Does the company have an employer PAYE reference number?
fields.helpText: It may be called ‘Employer PAYE reference’ or ‘PAYE reference’. It will be on your P60.

sections.title: What is the Employer PAYE reference?

fields.label: What is the Employer PAYE reference?
fields.helpText: This is a 3 digit tax office number, a forward slash, and a tax office employer reference, like 123/AB456. It may be called ‘Employer PAYE reference’ or ‘PAYE reference’. It will be on your P60.

sections.title: Does the company have any HMRC reference numbers?

fields.label: Does the company have any HMRC reference numbers?
fields.helpText: Your company will have a reference number if it has been registered for an HMRC service. You only need to provide one.
choices: Annual Tax on Enveloped Dwellings (ATED) related Capital Gains Tax reference
The company does not have any HMRC references

fields.label: Where to find an HMRC reference number
fields.infoText:
HMRC gives every company a unique reference number in order to deal with its tax affairs. You'll find it either:

• in your HMRC online account 

• on official communications from HMRC

sections.title: What is your non-resident Capital Gains Tax reference number?

fields.label: What is your non-resident Capital Gains Tax reference number?
fields.helpText: The charge reference number is made up of 14 or 15 characters, starting with an X. HMRC emailed this to the company after we received the company's Capital Gains Tax return.

sections.title: What is your Annual Tax on Enveloped Dwellings (ATED) related Capital Gains Tax reference?

fields.label: What is your Annual Tax on Enveloped Dwellings (ATED) related Capital Gains Tax reference?
fields.helpText: The ATED-related Capital Gains Tax reference number is made up of 14 characters, starting with an ‘X’.

sections.title: What is your company's VAT registration number?

fields.label: What is your company's VAT registration number?
fields.helpText: This is 9 numbers, sometimes with ‘GB’ at the start, for example 123456789 or GB123456789. You can find it on your VAT registration certificate.

sections.title: Provide your HMRC reference details

fields.label: Type of reference
fields.helpText: For example, a non-resident Capital Gain Tax reference, Annual Tax on Enveloped Dwellings reference or VAT reference number

sections.title: Enter the company's incorporation details

fields.label: Date of incorporation
fields.helpText: For example, 01 08 2007

fields.label: Country of incorporation
fields.helpText: This is where the company was formed

fields.label: You must use accepted geographical names to complete our forms. If you do not, we might reject your filing.
fields.infoText: You must use official geographical names to complete our forms.

fields.label: Guidance on geographical names
fields.infoText:
Go to GOV.UK and search for 'Nationalities and countries for company filings', in this guidance select the document 'Geographical names'. 
Use the list of countries and territories when doing your company filings.

fields.label: Is this the country of tax residence?

sections.title: What is the country of tax residence?

fields.label: What is the country of tax residence?
fields.helpText: Enter the country where the company currently pays tax

fields.label: Guidance on geographical names
fields.infoText:
Go to GOV.UK and search for 'Nationalities and countries for company filings', in this guidance select the document 'Geographical names'. 
Use the list of countries and territories when doing your company filings.

sections.title: Does the company have a reference number or equivalent?

fields.label: Does the company have a reference number or equivalent?
fields.helpText: This is the number given to the company when it was formed. This may also be referred to as a registration number.

sections.title: What is the company reference number?

fields.label: What is the company reference number?
fields.helpText: This information will help us to confirm its identity

sections.title: Registered office address

fields.label:
This is the official registration address listed on your country's public register. It is where official communication is sent, for example letters from your government or tax authority.

HMRC will send correspondence to this address.
fields.infoText:
This is the official registration address listed on your country's public register. It is where official communication is sent, for example letters from your government or tax authority.

HMRC will send correspondence to this address.

fields.label: Telephone number
fields.helpText: Include the country code

sections.title: Company director details
Is the company a member of a group?

fields.label: Is the company a member of a group?

sections.title: Parent company details

fields.label: Is this the country of tax residence?

sections.title: What is the parent company's country of tax residence?

fields.label: What is the parent company's country of tax residence?
fields.helpText: This is the country where the company currently pays tax

fields.label: Guidance on geographical names
fields.infoText:
Go to GOV.UK and search for 'Nationalities and countries for company filings', in this guidance select the document 'Geographical names'. 
Use the list of countries and territories when doing your company filings.

sections.title: Does the parent company have a company reference number or equivalent?

fields.label: Does the parent company have a company reference number or equivalent?
fields.helpText: This may also be referred to as a registration number and is used to identify a company's legal existence

sections.title: What is the reference number of the parent company?

fields.label: What is the reference number of the parent company?
fields.helpText: This information will help us to confirm the identity of the company

sections.title: What UK business activity do you want to tell HMRC about?

fields.label: What UK business activity do you want to tell HMRC about?
fields.helpText: A disposal of a property refers to a sale, a gift or a transfer of ownership
choices: More than 1 disposal or other business activities

fields.label: UK business activities chargeable to UK Corporation Tax
fields.infoText:
You must tell HMRC if you are:

• selling assets

• carrying on a business activity such as a trade or professional activity

• buying and selling goods with a view to making a profit

• providing services

• earning interest

• managing investments

• receiving any other income

sections.title: Enter the date you became chargeable to UK Corporation Tax

fields.label: This is the date the property transferred out of your company's possession.
fields.infoText: This is the date the property transferred out of your company's possession.

fields.helpText: For example, 01 08 2018

sections.title: Enter the period chargeable to UK Corporation Tax

fields.label: This is the period in which your company plans to conduct business chargeable for UK Corporation Tax.
fields.infoText: This is the period in which your company is chargeable for UK Corporation Tax.

fields.label: Date you came within charge to UK Corporation Tax
fields.helpText: For example, 31 03 2018

fields.label: Date you will prepare your next accounts to
fields.helpText: For example, 31 08 2019

sections.title: Has the company you are registering taken over another UK business?
sections.shortName: The company has taken over another UK business

fields.label: Has the company you are registering taken over another UK business?

sections.title: Select which type of UK business the company has taken over

fields.label: Select which type of UK business the company has taken over

sections.title: Company details

fields.infoText: These are the details of the company which has transferred its business to you.

fields.label: Trading name
fields.helpText: Enter the trading name if different from the company name

sections.title: Company director details

fields.label: Enter the details of the main company director.
fields.infoText: Enter the details of the principal company director. This is the previous director of the business.

sections.title: Enter the details of the previous sole trader

fields.label: Trading name (optional)
fields.helpText: Enter the trading name if different from the sole trader's name

sections.title: Partnership details

fields.label: These are the details of the partnership which has transferred its business to you.
fields.infoText: These are the details of the partnership which has transferred its business to you.

sections.title: Partner details

fields.label: Enter the details of the principle or nominated partner.
fields.infoText: Enter the details of the principle or nominated partner.

fields.label: Partner name
fields.helpText: This is one of the previous owners of the business

declarationSection.title: Make your declaration and send the form

fields.label: Declaration copy
fields.infoText: By submitting this form you declare that the information that you have provided is true and complete.

fields.label: Declaration copy
fields.infoText: If you give incomplete or inaccurate information, we may charge a financial penalty or even prosecute you.

This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted registration.

We will use the information you have provided to set up a record for the company and send you a Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference. We will also send you more information about what you need to do next.
You will only be able to register for online services and file your return once you have received your Unique Taxpayer Reference.
